item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 21, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Niantic announces “Large Geospatial Model” trained on Pokémon Go player data (341 points | 267 comments)
2. Everyone is capable of, and can benefit from, mathematical thinking (92 points | 37 comments)
3. Electrobun: Cross-platform desktop applications written in TypeScript (109 points | 27 comments)
4. The Matrix: Infinite-Horizon World Generation with Real-Time Interaction (41 points | 8 comments)
5. Show HN: We open-sourced our compost monitoring tech (69 points | 16 comments)
6. Building Databases over a Weekend (67 points | 9 comments)
7. DOJ filed paperwork to US District Court to force Google to spin off Chrome [pdf] (65 points | 31 comments)
8. The Fastest Redis Ever (20 points | 4 comments)
9. Weight-loss drug found to shrink heart muscle in mice, human cells (207 points | 234 comments)
10. Z-Library Helps Students to Overcome Academic Poverty, Study Finds (256 points | 56 comments)
11. AlphaQubit: AI to identify errors in Quantum Computers (107 points | 43 comments)
12. Undergraduates with family income below $200k will be tuition-free at MIT (494 points | 351 comments)
13. Doxx/Darkflare: DarkFlare TCPoCDN (TCP over CDN) (65 points | 14 comments)
14. Why everyone missed solar's exponential growth (31 points | 14 comments)
15. Boeing overcharged the U.S. Air Force 8,000% above market for soap dispensers (43 points | 28 comments)
16. January 1928: Dirac equation unifies quantum mechanics and special relativity (15 points | 8 comments)
17. What is the origin of the lake tank image that has become a meme? (2021) (529 points | 119 comments)
18. Vapi (YC W21) Is Hiring Founding Senior Engineer (Front End) ( | hide)
19. How good are American roads? (184 points | 395 comments)
20. Show HN: Autotab – Programmable AI browser for turning web tasks into APIs (88 points | 39 comments)
21. New Calculation Finds we are close to the Kessler Syndrome [video] (73 points | 85 comments)
22. SQL, Homomorphisms and Constraint Satisfaction Problems (126 points | 12 comments)
23. Fashion History Timeline (17 points | 1 comment)
24. Why one would use Qubes OS? (2023) (6 points | 2 comments)
25. Bit-twiddling optimizations in Zed's Rope (107 points | 38 comments)
26. Does the Internet Route Around Damage? – Baltic Sea Cable Cuts (64 points | 13 comments)
27. Pipe Viewer – A Unix Utility You Should Know About (156 points | 28 comments)
28. Show HN: Convolution Solver and Visualizer (4 points | discuss)
29. Between the Booms: AI in Winter – Communications of the ACM (64 points | 44 comments)
30. Gregglogger (18 points | 5 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 21, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
